intro: Chaetoseris sichuanensis, commonly known as the Sichuan chaetoseris, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and has small, narrow leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are usually yellow or pale green, and it produces small, elongated fruits. It is often found in rocky or grassy habitats at higher elevations.
